title: Seared Branzino with Herbed Couscous
description: Crisp-skinned seared branzino served over fluffy herbed couscous with lemon, parsley and a touch of garlic. Bright Mediterranean flavors and quick pan-searing make this a weeknight dinner that feels elegant.

ingredients.display_name: whole branzino, cleaned and scaled (about 8-10 oz each)
ingredients.notes: gut removed, patted dry; leave head on or off per preference

ingredients.display_name: low-sodium chicken or vegetable stock, hot

steps.text: Prep fish and couscous: rinse branzino and pat thoroughly dry with paper towels; season cavity and skin lightly with half of the salt and pepper. Measure couscous and bring stock to a simmer in a small saucepan.
Bloom couscous: add couscous to a heatproof bowl, stir in olive oil and a pinch of salt, pour hot stock over couscous, cover tightly and let sit undisturbed until absorbed and tender.

Finish couscous: fluff couscous with a fork, stir in butter, minced shallot, half the garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, chopped parsley, optional mint, red pepper flakes if using, adjust seasoning with remaining salt and pepper; keep warm.

Preheat pan and dust fish (optional): heat a large heavy skillet (preferably stainless steel or cast iron) over medium-high heat until very hot; optionally dust skin lightly with flour to aid crisping and shake off excess.

Sear branzino skin-side down: add 1 to 1.5 tablespoons olive oil to pan, place branzino in pan skin-side down and press gently with a spatula to ensure full contact; cook without moving until skin is deep golden and crisp.

Flip and finish: turn fish, add a tablespoon of butter and remaining minced garlic to the pan, spoon melted butter over fish while cooking just until opaque through and cooked to medium (flesh flakes and registers about 135-140°F if using thermometer).

Rest and plate: remove fish to a warm plate and rest 1–2 minutes; quickly toss couscous to revive fluff, divide couscous among plates, place seared branzino on top, spoon pan juices over fish, garnish with capers and additional parsley and lemon wedges.
Final seasoning and serve: taste and adjust with additional lemon juice or salt as desired and serve immediately while skin is crisp.
